intro: Pentacalia discolor, commonly known as the white milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant produces showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. The plant contains toxic sap and is typically found in moist, woodland habitats.
